results.title: A Brush with nature, Robert Ulmann
results.creator_credit: Toni Steinbrecher, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
The return of the southern right whale to Australia’s southern coast is observed and recorded in the art of Swiss-Australian wildlife artist, Robert Ulmann. He has found a new life in an area that most Australians would avoid as desolate, dangerous and bleak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Toni Steinbrecher, ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: The Koala quandry
results.creator_credit: John Muirhead, Dione Gilmour and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
An examination of the feeding and habitat of the koala, the likely survival of the species in the face of environmental and biological threats is discussed.

results.title: The King's life guard
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Realist Films
results.brief_description: The ceremony of the Changing of the Guard. Shows the preparation of the household cavalry at the Royal barracks and stables followed by the procession and finally the actual ceremony.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
Describes the habitat and adaptive behaviour of a colony of grey-headed flying foxes in suburban Sydney.

results.title: The Kind hearted ant
results.creator_credit: Vladimir Jutrisa, Aleksandar Marks and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: In an anthill of five million ants, there is always one ant out of step. Based on a Yugoslavian children’s song, this animated film tells the story of an ant who unintentionally disrupts the harmony and order of the ant-hill. A sardonic survey of insect behaviour, charming and genuinely funny using a striking yet simple visual style.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.

results.title: The Koala. - Rev ed.
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film looks at the biological characteristics of the koala and the various types which are determined by its climatic region in Eastern Australia. Those features which make the koala peculiarly adaptable to its territorial environment are described and its life cycle is surveyed. A shorter, revised version of T/Code 005919.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: The Karate Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts, teaches him karate and that fighting is always a last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self confidence.

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: These seven stories are a culmination of a Digital Storytelling ‘Train the trainer’ workshop, held at ACMI in April 2008. The stories are of a personal nature and are centred around an important part of the participant’s lives.
